definition: outrageous and unconventional (idiom); flying in the face of (authority, convention, public opinion etc)

sentences.english: He flies in the face of public disapproval.
This is publicly available evidence that the post war power structure is ending.
sentences.chinese: 這是悍然可得的證據，戰後權力佈局曾經竣事了。

sentences.english: The pert injunction was like those crystal substances .
sentences.chinese: 這個悍然的命令就像晶體物質一般。

sentences.english: Recently, it flagrantly attacked the capital of Mosanbique, Mabuto, I mean the South African residents there.
sentences.chinese: 最近，它悍然襲擊莫桑比克首都馬布託南非人住所。

sentences.english: Cloud son also wrote a letter, brazen and left over the camp.
sentences.chinese: 雲子也寫了一封信，悍然與營左翻臉。

sentences.english: This flies in the face of the democratic ideal of the site.
sentences.chinese: 這做法悍然不顧網站的民主理想。

sentences.english: He is flagrantly disregarding the law.

definition: to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
to start/to launch/to unleash/to mobilize/to arouse
to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
open hostilities without declaring war/start an undeclared war
